title: Nail Technician (FT)
description:
J’adore Nails Salon & Spa is currently seeking for motivated and talented Nail Technician to join our team. If you have experience in the nail/spa industry and enjoy making people look and feel their best, then we would love to hear from you. The Nail Technician’s responsibilities include welcoming and greeting clients, and providing clients with high quality manicures, pedicures, and nail enhancement services. The Nail Technician is also responsible for answering clients’ nail relating questions.

Primary Duties: 
  • Provides high quality manicures and pedicures.
  • Applies artificial nails (acrylic and bio gel).
  • Shellac/gel polish application
  • Sterilize all nail instruments and equipment before each use.
  • Recommend various nail designs and nail art to clients.
  • Clean and prepare workstations before and after appointments.
  • Ensure that workstations are kept clean and orderly.
  • Interact with clients and salon staff in a professional manner.

Qualifications/Skills: 
  • Possess a valid Nail Technician Licence from the Cosmetology Association of Nova Scotia.
  • Be committed to customer service.
  • Detailed oriented and patient.
  • Excellent hand-eye coordination.
  • The ability to concentrate for extended periods of time.
  • Be committed to continuous learning and improvement in skillset.
  • Understand and implement sanitation and sterilization standards.

What we offer: 
  • Training to all our employees.
  • Assistance in building clientele.
  • A salon located in a high traffic area.

Compensation:
Commission based, depends on experience.

How to Apply:
To apply for this position please email your resume to

thuy.nguyen@jadorenails.ca

.

title: Nail Technician
description:
O Coiffure & Spa is your destination for relaxation, self-care, and connection in Downtown Montreal.
We are redefining urban pampering by creating a space for decadent experiences through our one-of-a-kind hair salon, spa, and cocktail bar. Established in 1981, our team has worked tirelessly over the years to stay on the leading edge of indulgence. We are constantly evolving to create an environment in which you can relax, destress, and refresh yourself as we unleash your beauty from the inside out. Go solo and get your cut, coloured, and styled, or enjoy our full suite of aesthetics services with our expert team. Bring your friends and revel in luxurious mani-pedis and facials. Or just sip a signature cocktail or matcha at our super chill “O Lounge” cocktail bar. Whatever you choose, you’ll love creating moments and memories at your favorite escape from the city.

We are looking for a Nail Technician to provide nail care treatments to our guests based on their needs and preferences.

Nail Technician responsibilities include polishing fingernails and toenails, and applying shellac. If you’re up-to-date with nail art techniques and know how to provide excellent customer service, we’d like to meet you.

Ultimately, you will help us boost our reputation by offering personalized services to our guests.

Because of COVID-19 a number of new hygiene & safety protocols have been put into place. It is our number one commitment to keep our professionals as well as our guests safe and healthy.

Responsibilities

  • Apply polish on fingernails and toenails
  • Clean, cut and shape nails
  • Recommend colors based on each guest style
  • Remove previously applied regular polish or shellac
  • Prepare and clean beauty station in-between appointments
  • Sterilize equipment before use
  • Inform guests about additional services and offers
  • Give hand and foot massages
  • Offer nail care treatment tips (e.g. how to strengthen nails and how to make manicures last longer)
  • Up-sell treatments and beauty products, when appropriate
  • Take an interest in guests (e.g. chatting with them during appointments and remembering their preferences)

Requirements

  • Proven work experience as a Nail Technician, Manicurist or similar role for 2 years.
  • Expertise in basic and advanced nail techniques, including french manicures, and shellac manicures
  • Knowledge of cosmetology trends
  • Understanding of sanitation and sterilization standards
  • Experience in customer service
  • High school diploma
  • Certification in Cosmetology or Nail Art is a plus

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $34,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Store discount

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Montréal, QC H3G 1W9: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)
